intro: Henckelia curtisii, commonly known as the Curtis's henckelia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of blue or violet. It grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
